comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Albion Fellows Bacon (1865-1933; Albion was her first name, not her husband's--she was married to Hilary E. Bacon, a banker) was a "municipal housekeeper" or social reformer in Evansville, Indiana, best known for improving conditions in tenements, in child welfare policy, in city planning, and in public health. She organized the Indiana Housing Association, drafted a state housing law, and served as an officer of the Indiana Child Welfare Association. books.google.com/books?id=v_flvpKK1nUC Today there is an Albion Fellows Bacon Center in Evansville, a shelter whose mission is "to eliminate domestic and sexual violence in our communities through advocacy, education, support services and collaborative partnership." www.albionfellowsbacon.org/

comment.author: 26741498@N00
comment._content: She is buried in Oak Hill Cemetery in Evansville, Indiana - www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GSln=bacon&...;
